metro.TrainManagement.Nodes

Class RailwayNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • metro.TrainManagement.Nodes.RailwayNode

  • public class RailwayNode
extends java.lang.Object
    A railway node is a point that's used by train lines and every node has neighbors (both know each other). Train lines are not drawn here even if they're only node connections (they are drawn in the TrainLine class).
    Author:
    hauke

    • Constructor Detail

      • RailwayNode

        RailwayNode(java.awt.Point position,
           RailwayNode neighbor)
        Creates a new node at the given position with a specific neighbor.
        Parameters:
        position - The position (NOT pixel) of the node. null indicates that the node will not be added to the overseer (because it's invalid).
        neighbor - The neighbor of the node.

      • RailwayNode

        RailwayNode(java.awt.Point position,
           java.util.ArrayList<RailwayNode> neighbors)
        Creates a new node at the given position with some specified neighbors.
        Parameters:
        position - The position (NOT pixel) of the node. null indicates that the node will not be added to the overseer (because it's invalid).
        neighbors - The neighbors of the node.

        Adds a node to the List of neighbors.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to add

      • addSimple

        public void addSimple(RailwayNode node)
        Adds a railway node to the list of neighbors without (!) adding himself to the node.
        Parameters:
        node - Node to add.

      • getPosition

        public java.awt.Point getPosition()
        Returns position of Node. NOT in pixel but the cross coordinates.
        Returns:
        Position.

      • getNeighbors

        Returns:
        Neighbors as ArrayList.

      • isNeighbor

        public boolean isNeighbor(RailwayNode node)
        Checks if the given node is a neighbor of this node.
        Parameters:
        node - The presumed neighbor.
        Returns:
        True when the given node is a neighbor, otherwise false.

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch sp,
        java.awt.Point offset)
        Draws a railway node and its neighbors. An algorithm takes care of NOT drawing nodes twice.
        Parameters:
        sp - The sprite batch.
        offset - An map offset in pixel.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • setSignalValue

        public void setSignalValue(RailwayNode successor,
                  Train train)
        Sets the value of a signal for the part between this node and the successor (looking in the successors direction). The successor gives the direction of the signal and the value is like a "red" or "green" for the signal.
        Parameters:
        successor - The successor of this node.
        train - The train that's allowed to drive in the part between this node and the successor.

      • getSignalValue

        public boolean getSignalValue(RailwayNode successor,
                     Train train)
        Gets the value of the signal for the part between this node and the successor (looking in the successors direction).
        Parameters:
        successor - The successor of the signal to determine the direction of it.
        train - The train that wants to pass the signal.
        Returns:
        The value of the signal for the given train, where true means "green" and false means "red", for the part between this node and the successor. When there's no signal specified by the setSignalValue(RailwayNode, boolean) method, the value is true.

      • unlockSignals

        public void unlockSignals()
        Sets every signal to "green".
